title: Billingshurst Canal and River Walk Route

images.title: Chris Plunkett / Once the Wey & Arun canal
images.caption: Once the Wey & Arun canal. Taken near to Billingshurst,this line of trees marks the course of the old Wey & Arun Canal, which has been disused now for over 100 years.This photo was taken facing south east.

images.title: Andy Potter / Well maintained footpath by Brockhurst Brook
images.caption: Well maintained footpath by Brockhurst Brook

images.title: Andy Potter / Footpath 827 from Lordings Road
images.caption: Footpath 827 from Lordings Road. The footpath follows the drive of Guildenhurst Manor until it turns to cross Guildenhurst Bridge to continue to the A272 near Wharf Farm.

images.title: nick macneill / The River Arun, New Bridge, West Sussex
images.caption: The River Arun, New Bridge, West Sussex. The River Arun flows beside the abandoned Wey and Arun Canal which is unseen to the left of the photo.

images.title: Simon Carey / Wey and Arun Junction Canal
images.caption: Wey and Arun Junction Canal. Looking south from the landing stage next to Malham Bridge. Starting from here the canal is extent until Guildenhurst Bridge though it was last cleared and dredged in 1982.

description: A circular walk in Billingshurst taking in the Wey and Arun Canal and the River Arun. It's about a 3 mile walk with some nice views of the river and the surrounding West Sussex countryside. The walk starts just to the west of the village at New Bridge where you can pick up the Wey South Path and follow the waymarked trail south west to Guildenhurst Bridge and Lording's Lock on the canal. The route then heads north east following other footpaths along the River Arun to the Brockhurst Brook. You then follow paths north west to return to the New Bridge where the walk finishes.
